snp1.10:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Āḷavī in the haunt of the native spirit Āḷavaka.
snp1.10:1.3: Then the native spirit Āḷavaka went up to the Buddha, and said to him:
snp1.10:1.5: Saying, “All right, sir,” the Buddha went out.
snp1.10:1.7: Saying, “All right, sir,” the Buddha went in.
snp1.10:2.2: And for a third time the native spirit Āḷavaka said to the Buddha,
snp1.10:2.4: Saying, “All right, sir,” the Buddha went out.
snp1.10:2.6: Saying, “All right, sir,” the Buddha went in.
snp1.10:3.1: And for a fourth time the native spirit Āḷavaka said to the Buddha,
snp1.10:4.1: “I will ask you a question, ascetic.
snp1.10:4.2: If you don’t answer me, I’ll drive you insane, or explode your heart, or grab you by the feet and throw you to the far shore of the Ganges!”
snp1.10:5.1: “I don’t see anyone in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans who could do that to me.
snp1.10:5.2: But anyway, ask what you wish.”
snp1.10:5.3: Then the native spirit Āḷavaka addressed the Buddha in verse:
snp1.10:6.2: What brings happiness when practiced well?
